qas.question: What year did Kinnock call for a general election?
What was the original Tory lead percentage?
What did the percentage fall to?
When was any Conservative lead in the polls sufficient for a majority?
Who followed Kinnock's calls for a general election?
How long had Labour ruled unbroken?
When did the Conservatives have a 14-point lead?

context: The "yo yo" in the opinion polls continued into 1992, though <b4_0>after November 1990<b4_0/> any Labour lead in the polls was rarely sufficient for a majority. <b5_0>Major<b5_0/> resisted Kinnock's calls for a general election throughout <a0_0>1991<a0_0/>. Kinnock campaigned on the theme <a1_0><b6_0>"It's Time for a Change"<b6_0/><a1_0/>, urging voters to elect a new government after more than <b7_0>a decade<b7_0/> of unbroken Conservative rule. However, the Conservatives themselves had undergone a dramatic change in the change of leader from Thatcher to Major, at least in terms of style if not substance. From the outset, it was clearly a well-received change, as Labour's <a2_0>14<a2_0/>-point lead in the <b8_0>November 1990<b8_0/> "Poll of Polls" was replaced by an <a3_0>8%<a3_0/> Tory lead a month later.
